result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica Nicole Marsh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for child care. Court allows for good time credit.

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

Provide DNA sample.
Court set restitution at $0.00.
Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
No driving without a valid driver's license.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica Nicole Marsh

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for child care.  Court allows for good time credit. 

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. 
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Driver's license revoked for a period of 6 MONTHS.
- No driving without a valid driver's license. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 

Court set restitution at $0.00.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Jessica Nicole Marsh in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Jessica Nicole Marsh.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  


Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded.

Defendant Jessica Nicole Marsh in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that parties are now in a resolution posture. Court adjourns matter for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 02.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jessica Nicole Marsh in court with attorney Robert J Hampton, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person and Thomas Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jessica Nicole Marsh in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jessica Nicole Marsh
Current: 2842A N Bremen st, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 05-19-2022)
Prior: 2962A North Fratney Street #A, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/19/2022@1:00pm
